page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: All the group drove along the A11 Norwich - London trunk road on 15.7.85. Recently increased traffic due to container lorries travelling to the East Coast ports, the North sea gas and oil industries, tourism, bus and coach services and a large local car owning population has put great pressure on this road. Ten thousand vehicles a day were passing through Attleborough and in May 1985, Mrs Linda Chalker opened a 5 mile by-pass to relieve the problem. Travelling from Norwich the by-pass begins in our D block, near the Spooner Row turn and just at its beginning is the stone pillar commemorating Â£200 given by Sir Edwin Rich for the first turnpike. Sadly, soon after the opening, a fatal accident between a coach and a lorry occured near here, attracting national media attention.
